content.question: Two balls with masses m and 2m approach each other with equal speeds v on a horizontal frictionless table, as shown in the top view above. Which of the following shows possible velocities of the balls for a time soon after the balls collide?

choices.label: Five answer choices are shown. Each shows two balls on a horizontal dashed line and a vertical dashed line that bisect each other. Choice A shows the ball of mass m on the vertical dashed line above the intersection moving straight up as indicated by an arrow and the ball of mass 2 times m on the vertical dashed line below the intersection moving straight down a indicated by an arrow of the same length.

Five answer choices are shown. Each shows two balls on a horizontal dashed line and a vertical dashed line that bisect each other. The ball of mass 2 times m is on the horizontal dashed line to the left of the intersection moving to the left as indicated by an arrow half as long as the other arrow.
